V.iii.4.A.3.b
.
Identifying the Cause of Coexisting Chronic Upper Respiratory Tract Infections
The cause of two or more coexisting chronic upper respiratory tract infections is commonly the same infectious process.Â  However, if two or more chronic infections persist over a period of years, give the probability of causation by separate types of organisms due weight.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 4, Section A - Respiratory Conditions
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 4, Section A
